duck: Wendland is a region in Germany on the borders of the present states of Brandenburg, Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Lower Saxony and Saxony-Anhalt.
Hanoverian Wendland is both the historical and the contemporary term for the region Lüchow-Dannenberg in the German Land of Lower Saxony.

milestones: Google purchases YouTube for $1.65 billion

wiki.text:
]] The 'Wendland' is a region in Germany on the borders of the present states
of Brandenburg, Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Lower Saxony and Saxony-Anhalt.
Its heart is the Hanoverian Wendland in the county of Lüchow-Dannenberg in
Lower Saxony.

In 2012 the state of Lower Saxony nominated the [[Rundling]] villages in
Hanoverian Wendland for the German shortlist of candidates for future UNESCO
World Heritage Sites. Subsequent decisions that will determine the success of
this bid take place in 2013 at the conference of education ministers
([[Kultusministerkonferenz]]) and no earlier than 2017 by UNESCO.<ref>[http://www.haz.de/Nachrichten/Der-Norden/Uebersicht/Wer-wird-
Welterbe Wer wird Welterbe? in: Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung dated 18 June
2012]</ref>
wiki.title: wendland
